Texts.Chs: 第一天(再放送) - 决定以日期计数器为开始。今天有新访客。好吧，其中一个并不新鲜。显然，我需要告诉过去的自己‘凯文又卡住了’。原来，他被卡在天花板的一部分。也许我不应该随便和别人分享这个新配方。
Texts.Eng: Day 1 (Again) - Decided to start over the day counter. Saw new visitors today. Well, one wasn't new. Apparently, I needed to tell my past self that 'Kevin is stuck again'. Turns out, he was stuck partway in the ceiling. Maybe I shouldn't share that new recipe with just anyone.

Texts.Chs: 在前哨站的第1天 - 我从不记录日子。但是我意识到的第一天... 很有趣。我睡着了，然后又醒了。我算是一颗有知觉的星星。当我问起这些小生物的时候，它们都笑了，尽管星之子们确实存在。“星星会思考吗？”
Texts.Eng: Day 1 at the outpost - I don't keep track of days. But the first day I was aware was...interesting. I was asleep, then I was awake. A star, sentient. These little creatures laugh when I ask about it, despite the existence of the Novakid. 'Do stars think?'

Texts.Chs: 第11天 - 一个叫“凯文”的人把我整笑了。他在科学方面的研究远远超过其他任何一位科学家，但在愚蠢的恶作剧自娱自乐的方面浪费了他的大部分潜力。他试图搞点恶作剧——用装满狼的盒子作为“欢迎礼物”。这些狼骨瘦如柴，味道也不好。
Texts.Eng: Day 11 - The one called 'Kevin' amuses me. He studies sciences far beyond what any of these other scientists do, but wastes much of his potential on entertaining himself with foolish pranks. He attempted one such prank on me. A box full of wolves as a 'welcome gift'. They were scrawny and didn't taste good.

Texts.Chs: 第14天 - 另一个恶作剧... 一个装满蜜蜂的公文包。当我把它们放进装满橙汁的盒子里退回去时，凯文似乎并不觉得好笑。声称我侵犯了一项专利。我以为他装的是酸牛奶和蜜蜂？不管怎么说，根据守卫不严谨的违规记录来看，就是这回事。
Texts.Eng: Day 14 - Another prank...a briefcase full of bees. Kevin didn't seem amused when I returned them, mixed into cartons of orange juice. Claimed I was infringing on a patent. I thought his was sour milk and bees? According to the poorly guarded infraction log it was, anyway.

Texts.Chs: 第17天 - 凯文挥着手走了过来，然后他说：“吸进去，胖猫咪”...然后朝我扔了一个中子弹。不错的零食。然后他问我想不想看魔术表演。忍不住...答应了。到底是什么把戏？他向市场上那个恼人的耳廓狐发射了一台原子粉碎机，但似乎没有一台。 给了我蓝图，说“为了科学！” 此外，他还将噪音发生器的重生延迟设置为一周。
Texts.Eng: Day 17 - Along comes Kevin waving about his hands, then "Suck it in, fat kitty" he said...and threw a neutron bomb at me. Nice snack. Then he asked me if I wanted to see a magic trick. Couldn't resist...said yes. What was the trick? He fired an Atom Smasher at that annoying Fenerox in the market, without seemingly having one. Gave me the blueprint and said "For Science!" Also, he set the noisemaker's respawn delay to a week.

Texts.Chs: 第17天 - 凯文给我带来了一份礼物...这次是一份出人意料的好礼物。一整托盘的金条。一个小时后，一群人类中的一个闯了进来，要求我们把金条送回去。但我给了他们一块我雕刻成粗糙阴茎的泡泡糖，然后对他们“凯文给我闪亮亮！”这促使他们一边走出房间一边骂脏话。
Texts.Eng: Day 17 - Kevin brought me a gift...a surprisingly good one, this time. An entire pallet of gold bars. An hour later one of the humans barged in demanding they be returned. Offered them a piece I'd sculped into a crude poptop penis and said 'Kevin give shiny!' That prompted them to walk out of the room while yelling obscenities.

Day 18 - Should have guessed Kevin had an ulterior motive. I had to correct the blueprint, his design was unstable. Found one of his bodies exploded in one of the vents, mixed with his Atom Smasher. He didn't seem too upset by it.

Day 19 - Apparently, a week is two days. That damn squeaker is back and keeps trying to sell me their garbage. No, I do not want to buy a used fur throw! Did manage to reverse-engineer the orange Kevin gave me. Some 'dare' that was.

Texts.Chs: 第2天 - 我意识到时间的概念是一些渺小生物所着迷的东西。他们测量它，量化它，但是太多的时候他们忘记了时间的过去，而且太多的时候他们在我的心脏跳动跳之前就消亡了。我还在适应这一切。
Texts.Eng: Day 2 - I realized the concept of time is something smaller beings are obsessed with. They measure it, quantify it, yet far too often lose track of its passing and all too often they fade before my core pulses once. Still getting used to that.

Texts.Chs: 第23天 - 看来凯文知道我是谁了。他带来了一个小型的太阳系，完全由超致密锭制成，但是用我的黑曜石雕塑取代了中间的太阳。然后他用各种各样的问题轰炸我，问我对各种各样的怪物或先驱生物了解多少，以及我是否吃过人等等。除了最后一个问题之外，他礼貌得出奇。他认为我会吃人吗？
Texts.Eng: Day 23 - So it would appear Kevin knows what I am. He came in with a small scale solar system, entirely made of densinium, but had replaced the sun at the center with an obsidian sculpture of me. He then bombarded me with questions, asking what I knew of various eldritch or precursor beings and whether I had ever eaten people, among other things. He was...oddly polite, except that last question. Does he think I'll eat someone?

Texts.Chs: 第24天 - 我发现了为什么凯文在问问题时那么有礼貌。我发现他试图在人体皮肤上做文字复刻。我给了他一次选择: 获得更多关于某些先驱机器的技术知识，或者发布录音，然后看着他的复制终端被吞噬。他选择了先驱技术。
Texts.Eng: Day 24 - Found out why Kevin was so polite when asking questions. I caught him trying to make written copies on sections of human skin. Gave him a choice: get more technical knowledge of certain precursor machines, or publish the recordings and watch as his replication terminal gets swallowed whole. He chose the precursor tech.

Texts.Chs: 第25天 - 凯文学得很快。学会了如何重新激活停滞系统，并用它们来储存吐舌娃。简直是光怪陆离，直到他让叶族人在餐厅。否则叶族人们今晚就要饿肚子了。
Texts.Eng: Day 25 - Kevin's a quick study. Learned how to reactivate the stasis systems and used them to store poptops. Oddly amusing, up until he let them out in the dining room. The florans went hungry tonight.
Day 26 - Kevin has been missing a week. Not unheard of, but usually he leaves something to keep people busy. This time he's just...absent.

Texts.Chs: 第27天 - 他复制了我的枪...然后那该死的东西就像生日派对一样喷出格雷格的口音。他还声称，他大量生产廉价仿制品，以分散“农民”的注意力，但我担心他们可能最终回到这里。我们不需要格雷格再次感染，即使他声称他做了故障保护。
Texts.Eng: Day 27 - He made a copy of my gun...and the damn thing spews gregisms like it's a birthday party. He also claims he mass-produced cheap knockoffs to distract the 'peasants', but I worry that they might end up back here. We don't need another Greg infestation, even if he claims he made failsafes against it.

Texts.Chs: 第28天 - 几天的工作之后，我们设法将先驱停滞系统重新改造成一个有限形式的时间旅行系统。凯文正在测试，但他似乎不能比他最近的重生更进一步。不过，他承诺，如果我们能一起做点什么的话，他会保守我的秘密。不会说什么的。
Texts.Eng: Day 28 - Several days of work later, we managed to rework the precursor stasis system into a limited form of time travel. Kevin is testing it, but he can't seem to go further than his most recent respawn. He did, however, promise to keep my secret if we could work on something together. Wouldn't say what.

Texts.Chs: 第三天 - 我想知道在这个前哨站的生物是否意识到我猫一般的滑稽动作和单纯只是表象？如果他们知道我是什么，他们可能会要求我离开。他们没有一个能让我...
Texts.Eng: Day 3 - I wonder if the beings at this outpost realize that my catlike antics and simplemindedness are a facade? If they knew what I was, they might ask me to leave. Not like any of them could make me...

Texts.Chs: 第三天 - 昨天来的新人又来了。凯文让他们去找橙子。决定追随他们。也许他们会在提取设备里放些零食？ 嗯...古老的金币和阿沃斯水晶，也许还有一瓶特别的东西？凯文留下了一些奇怪的种子给我试着种植。肯定不是橙子树的种子。
Texts.Eng: Day 3 - New person from yesterday arrived again. Kevin sent them for oranges. Decided to follow them. Maybe they'll toss a few snacks in their extraction equipment? Mmm...ancient gold coins and avolite crystals, with a bottle of something special, maybe? Kevin left some weird seeds for me to try growing. Definitely weren't orange tree seeds.

Texts.Chs: 第34天 - 泡泡糖。为什么非得是泡泡糖? 至少他知道不能往我身上撒泡泡糖...但科学前哨基地的其他人几乎都被粘在天花板上了。 不过，尖叫者被困在了一个厕所里。 要么是凯文生气了，要么就是有人又在看我的日记。
Texts.Eng: Day 34 - Bubblegum. Why did it have to be bubblegum? At least he knew better than to drop any on me...but almost everyone else in the Science Outpost is stuck to the ceiling. Squeaker got stuck in an outhouse, though. Either Kevin got annoyed, or someone is reading my journal again.

Texts.Chs: 第35天 - 在我们上一个项目完成一周后，凯文带来了一些文件，文件详细描述了他的一个想法: 欺骗时空公司不断地重复使用某些设备。我建议简单的复制这些设备，但他只是拍拍我的头说：“傻猫，小把戏是给孩子玩的”。
Texts.Eng: Day 35 - A week after our last project, Kevin brought in papers detailing an idea he'd had; cheating spacetime to re-use certain devices continually. I suggested simple duplication, and he just patted my head and said 'silly kitty, tricks are for kids'.

Texts.Chs: 第35天 - 没有泡泡糖，相反，他带来了前哨站所有的黄金，在熔化状态下，在我在桥下打盹的时候融化在我身上。然后在我享受温暖的时候开始警告每个人这一天剩下的时间里有‘危险的护城河怪物’作祟。 不过，我想这次只有他在笑。
Texts.Eng: Day 35 - No bubblegum for me, instead he brought the outpost's entire supply of gold, in molten form, and dropped it on me while I was napping under the bridge. Then proceeded to warn everyone of the 'dangerous moat monster' for the rest of the day, while I was enjoying the warmth. I think only he is laughing this time, though.

Texts.Chs: 第39天 - 我们设法得到一个工程原型，虽然凯文在工作的时候一直试图讨要我的材料。我不停地提醒他我们需要这些东西来发电。遗憾的是，这些材料至少要供给我几个世纪。
Texts.Eng: Day 39 - We managed to get a working prototype, though Kevin kept trying to feed me the materials we were working with. Kept having to remind him we needed them for the generator. A pity, they would have fed me for a few centuries at minimum.

Texts.Chs: 第41天 - 凯文似乎超越了自己。每个人，包括他自己，他都把重心给颠倒过来。我不得不移除他放在我们其中一台发电机里的先驱引力节点。我不喜欢伪造物理场技术，但是其他人相信“想要漂亮的球!”的回答。所以我什么都不用解释。他们只是怪罪于凯文。
Texts.Eng: Day 41 - Seems Kevin outdid himself. Everyone, himself included, had their gravity reversed. I had to remove the precursor gravitic node he had placed in one of our generators. Didn't enjoy faking a physics field tech, but the others believed the response of 'Want pretty ball!' so I didn't have to explain anything. They just blamed Kevin.

Texts.Chs: 第45天 - 凯文走进来问我:“如果我这么胖，我是怎么挤进壳里的。”他之前的礼貌也就到此为止了...我告诉他: “吸进去的，小胖虫。”出于某种原因，他似乎对这个答案很满意。
Texts.Eng: Day 45 - Kevin came in and asked how I managed to fit in my shell if I was so fat. So much for his earlier politeness...I told him 'Suck it in, fatty bug.' He seemed pleased at the answer for some reason...

Texts.Chs: 第61天？或者是第71天？ - 决定今天试试酿酒，因为那个酒保好像很喜欢喝酒。 因为分心忘了凯文要来。 很自然地，他想要做出贡献... 然后开始把相物质和其他一些东西倒进我蒸馏出来的魂叶里。我告诉他不要喝，所以他自然就反其道而行。现在，他穿过人群，大喊‘蹦！’. 真好笑。我称这种酒为魂叶水花。
Texts.Eng: Day 61? Or is it 71? - Decided to try brewing today, since that drunk barkeep seems to love booze. Got distracted and forgot Kevin was coming by. Naturally, he wanted to 'contribute'...and proceeded to dump phase matter and a few other things into my distilled soulleaf. I told him not to drink it, so naturally he did the opposite. Now he's walking through people and shouting 'Boo!'. Hilarious. Calling it Soulleaf Spritz.

Texts.Chs: 溪的日记
Texts.Eng: Khe's Journal

Texts.Chs: 渺小的生命会写日记来记录事情。对吧？好吧。这是我的那份。我是溪，一颗蓝色的超巨星，假装成一个疯狂的爱猫人士。亲爱的读者: 如果你在未经我允许的情况下与任何人分享这些文章，你会发现被埋在熔化的金属缸里是什么感觉。
Texts.Eng: Little beings supposedly keep journals to record things. Right? Okay. This is mine. I'm Khe, a blue supergiant star pretending to be an insane cat-person. Dear reader: If you share this with anyone without my permission you will find out what it's like to be entombed in a vat of molten metal.
